              - text: DataBreach
              - generic [ref=e5446]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5447]:
              - generic [ref=e5448]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e5449]: term="Security"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Security
              - generic [ref=e5450]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5451]:
              - generic [ref=e5452]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e5453]: term="TroyHunt"
                - text: ">"
              - text: TroyHunt
              - generic [ref=e5454]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5455]:
              - generic [ref=e5456]: <description>
              - text: <p>Have you heard of the website <a href="https://haveibeenpwned.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://haveibeenpwned.com</a> ?</p> <p>Well you should have. Have I Been Pwned is a website created by security expert Troy Hunt that keeps track of data breaches and allows you to search and find ones that affect you. As I write this <a href="https://www.troyhunt.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Troy Hunt</a> has tracked 3,752,984,562 pwned accounts from 216 pwned websites.</p> <h3 id="what-does-pwned-mean">What does ‚Äúpwned‚Äù mean?<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#what-does-pwned-mean"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>pwn means to compromise or control, specifically another computer (server or PC), website, gateway device, or application. (as defined on wikipedia)</p> <p>Originally, pwn and its variants were pronounced /Àào än/ in the same way as the verb own, the tail of the p being ‚Äúsilent‚Äù.</p> <p>In terms of this site Troy Hunt defines it as:</p> <p><quote>A &ldquo;breach&rdquo; is an incident where a hacker illegally obtains data from a vulnerable system, usually by exploiting weaknesses in the software. All the data in the site comes from website breaches which have been made publicly available.</quote></p> <h3 id="what-can-i-do">What can I do?<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#what-can-i-do"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>As an individual you can search for your email address in Have I Been Pwned, I am in 7 data breaches.</p> <p>As a person responsible for an email domain you can search and find which of your users are in a data breach.</p> <p>You can also sign up to get notified of any future data breaches you might get caught up in.</p> <p>If you are in a data breach change your password. If you use the same password across multiple sites or services change them as well. Consider using a <a href="https://www.troyhunt.com/only-secure-password-is-one-you-cant/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">password manager</a> so you can have unique complex passwords for every services you use and not have to worry about forgetting them.</p> <p>If you look after a website or service then follow Troy Hunt. Think about security, is your site vulnerable to SQL injection, do you store passwords with reversible encryption?</p> <h3 id="how-worried-should-i-be">How worried should I be?<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#how-worried-should-i-be"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>Data breaches are happening more and more often. Its not showing any sign of slowing down, in fact I expect there to be lots more in the years to come. However there are things you can do to mitigate the damage of being in a breach.</p> <ul> <li>Use a password manager</li> <li>Don‚Äôt share passwords between sites</li> <li>Regularly change your passwords</li> <li>Think of passwords as pass phrases and include spaces between the different words</li> </ul> <p>Consider what information a company has about you. How worried would you be if this became public knowledge? Consider if you want this online, weigh up the benefits etc</p>
              - generic [ref=e5457]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e5459]: </item>

          - generic [ref=e5463]: <item>
          - generic [ref=e5464]:
            - generic [ref=e5465]:
              - generic [ref=e5466]: <title>
              - text: Star Trek Discovery ‚Äì thoughts on new trailer
              - generic [ref=e5467]: </title>
            - generic [ref=e5468]:
              - generic [ref=e5469]: <link>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2017/star-trek-discovery/
              - generic [ref=e5470]: </link>
            - generic [ref=e5471]:
              - generic [ref=e5472]: <author>
              - text: funkysi1701
              - generic [ref=e5473]: </author>
            - generic [ref=e5474]:
              - generic [ref=e5475]: <pubDate>
              - text: Mon, 22 May 2017 20:00:45 +0000
              - generic [ref=e5476]: </pubDate>
            - generic [ref=e5477]:
              - generic [ref=e5478]: <guid>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2017/star-trek-discovery/
              - generic [ref=e5479]: </guid>
            - generic [ref=e5480]:
              - generic [ref=e5481]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e5482]: term="StarTrek"
                - text: ">"
              - text: StarTrek
              - generic [ref=e5483]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5484]:
              - generic [ref=e5485]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e5486]: term="Discovery"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Discovery
              - generic [ref=e5487]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5488]:
              - generic [ref=e5489]: <description>
              - text: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/UoV3kc05Nwc" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe> <p>I am really excited a new Star Trek Discovery trailer has just been released, if you haven‚Äôt seen it yet, watch it now.</p> <p>The rumour mill has been going crazy about Star Trek Discovery but now we have a trailer with actual footage to analyse. In my opinion all the concerns about changes in the production team have gone out the window, this looks to be a polished Star Trek show that can sit alongside our favourites.</p> <h3 id="the-ship">The Ship<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#the-ship"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>When images first surfaced of the ship I wasn‚Äôt keen, however all the shots of the ship look great. I assume this must be the USS Discovery, although it is hard to tell anything from a two minute advert.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2017/DAD0hTKUAAAUkTP.jpg" loading="lazy" width="1199" height="663" /> </p> <h3 id="the-bridge">The Bridge<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#the-bridge"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>The Bridge looks recognisable as a Star Trek bridge, but also looks fresh and new. I think it feels very JJ Verse. I like it.</p> <h3 id="the-uniforms">The Uniforms<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#the-uniforms"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>The uniforms look like a mid step between what we saw on Enterprise and what we know as the Classic Trek look. I can‚Äôt see any Blue, Red, Gold to signify departments, but it looked like Gold and Silver could well signify something. Really hard to tell at this stage, but I like what I can see.</p> <h3 id="characters">Characters<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#characters"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>The show feels like it is going to be gritty and real. With characters you can really get behind. I liked what I saw of the captain and lead character. The alien character intrigued me, hopefully his line about death will be explored. It feels like there is a strong link between Vulcans and Sarek with the shows lead (played by Sonequa Martin-Green) Not sure how I feel about this yet, depends on what they do with it. I don‚Äôt want them to just redo what they have done with Spock, but again lets wait and see.</p> <h3 id="klingons">Klingons<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#klingons"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>OK I am not sure I like the strong emphasis on the Klingons. I think we have spent a lot of time learning about Klingons, so when I heard the casting news about Klingons I was not excited. The Klingons also have a new look, which doesn‚Äôt bother me that much as the Klingons have changed their look before. But lets wait and see what happens.</p> <h3 id="star-trek-is-back">Star Trek is back<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#star-trek-is-back"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h3> <p>After over a decade with no Star Trek on TV, it is finally coming back. I am beyond excited about this. There are lots of things I want from this new show but this advert has definitely rekindled my excitement and hope that we are going to get something good.</p>
              - generic [ref=e5490]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e5492]: </item>

          - generic [ref=e5496]: <item>
          - generic [ref=e5497]:
            - generic [ref=e5498]:
              - generic [ref=e5499]: <title>
              - text: Windows Update ‚Äì don‚Äôt turn it off!
              - generic [ref=e5500]: </title>
            - generic [ref=e5501]:
              - generic [ref=e5502]: <link>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2017/windows-update-dont-turn-off/
              - generic [ref=e5503]: </link>
            - generic [ref=e5504]:
              - generic [ref=e5505]: <author>
              - text: funkysi1701
              - generic [ref=e5506]: </author>
            - generic [ref=e5507]:
              - generic [ref=e5508]: <pubDate>
              - text: Mon, 15 May 2017 20:00:45 +0000
              - generic [ref=e5509]: </pubDate>
            - generic [ref=e5510]:
              - generic [ref=e5511]: <guid>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2017/windows-update-dont-turn-off/
              - generic [ref=e5512]: </guid>
            - generic [ref=e5513]:
              - generic [ref=e5514]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e5515]: term="Windows"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Windows
              - generic [ref=e5516]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5517]:
              - generic [ref=e5518]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e5519]: term="Update"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Update
              - generic [ref=e5520]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5521]:
              - generic [ref=e5522]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e5523]: term="ITAdmin"
                - text: ">"
              - text: ITAdmin
              - generic [ref=e5524]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e5525]:
              - generic [ref=e5526]: <description>
              - text: <p>No blog post this week. However why not check out Troy Hunts blog article about <a href="https://www.troyhunt.com/dont-tell-people-to-turn-off-windows-update-just-dont/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Windows Update</a> .</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2017/ximage7.png.pagespeed.gpjpjwpjwsjsrjrprwricpmd.ic_.OmA4sQpZUA.png" loading="lazy" width="464" height="288" /> </p> <p>I am probably fairly unique in that I like installing updates whether it be on my phone, my PC or for one of my favourite programs. One of my tasks when I used to work in a sysadmin role was ensuring all windows updates got installed on all servers and client machines. It was a never ending task, as soon as you got almost all updates done, it would be update Tuesday and a new set of updates would be released.</p> <p>I can think of a couple of times an update got installed that caused a problem and needed to be rolled back. However I have no way of measuring how often it fixed a problem or improved the security of the OS or other software. If you compare the annoyance of waiting for updates to install against having a computer (or worse a server) be hacked or otherwise compromised I think it is fairly clear what you need to do.</p> <p>As someone who works in IT I feel it is my duty to share the importance of keeping your devices updated. Don‚Äôt turn automatic updates off or disable it. It is there to help you and keep your computer safe and secure.</p>
              - generic [ref=e5527]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e5529]: </item>

</span></span><span style=\"display:flex;\"><span>}); </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This adds the data and sets up various options for the charts. More details about the different charts and options you can set can be found at <a href=\"https://www.highcharts.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">https://www.highcharts.com</a> </p> <p>I am quite a fan of the different gauges that you can put on your site, as you can add a bit of animation and make the needles bounce around. <a href=\"https://www.highcharts.com/demo/gauge-solid\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">https://www.highcharts.com/demo/gauge-solid</a> </p> <p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2017/chart-1.jpeg\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"1200\" height=\"400\" /> </p> <p>As most of the data I deal with lives in a SQL Server database, I have been spending quite a bit of time writing Stored Procedures and functions to mould the data so I can easily pass data from the database to javascript.</p> <p>Highcharts are very flexible with lots of different options that allow you to display charts of almost any data you have, these charts are also exportable as PNG, JPEG, CSVs etc</p>"
