                - text: ">"
              - text: Enterprise
              - generic [ref=e7055]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7056]:
              - generic [ref=e7057]: <description>
              - text: "<p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2016/07df3N8m.jpg\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"512\" height=\"512\" /> </p> <p>In 1966 a TV show called <a href=\"http://www.startrek.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Star Trek</a> first aired in the USA. Since then 726 episodes have been made and 12 films have been released. 2016 marks the 50th anniversary and Star Trek is as alive as ever with a new film due out this summer and a brand new TV series in the works for broadcast in 2017.</p> <p>But what can I do to celebrate? With that many episodes I don‚Äôt have enough time to re-watch every episode so how about a re-watch of the top 50 episodes.</p> <p>Star Trek has five live action TV series so all I need to do is pick my top 10 from each.</p> <h2 id=\"star-trek\">Star Trek<a class=\"anchor ms-1\" href=\"#star-trek\"><i class=\"fas fa-link\"></i></a></h2> <p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2016/Landing_party_beams_up_from_Guardian_planet.jpg\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"1440\" height=\"1080\" /> </p> <p>The original Star Trek series first aired on September 8th 1966. It lasted only three years and 79 episodes. This series featured the iconic characters Kirk, Spock and Bones on a five-year mission to explore space.</p> <ol> <li>The City on the Edge of Forever</li> <li>The Devil in the Dark</li> <li>Balance of Terror</li> <li>The Trouble with Tribbles</li> <li><a href=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/2016/01/21/star-trek-episode-review-arena/\">Arena</a> </li> <li>This Side of Paradise</li> <li>Amok Time</li> <li>Space Seed</li> <li>Mirror Mirror</li> <li>The Deadly Years</li> </ol> <h2 id=\"star-trek-the-next-generation\">Star Trek: The Next Generation<a class=\"anchor ms-1\" href=\"#star-trek-the-next-generation\"><i class=\"fas fa-link\"></i></a></h2> <p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2016/Senior_staff_poker_game.jpg\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"1436\" height=\"1080\" /> </p> <p>The first spin-off series set 100 years after Kirk featured a new Enterprise continuing to explore space. This series aired between 1987 and 1994 for 178 episodes.</p> <ol> <li><a href=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/2016/02/18/star-trek-episode-review-the-best-of-both-worlds/\">Best of Both Worlds</a> </li> <li>Yesterdays Enterprise</li> <li>The Offspring</li> <li>The Measure of a Man</li> <li>Disaster</li> <li>All Good Things‚Ä¶</li> <li>Tapestry</li> <li>The Inner Light</li> <li>Cause and Effect</li> <li>Unification</li> </ol> <h2 id=\"star-trek-deep-space-nine\">Star Trek: Deep Space Nine<a class=\"anchor ms-1\" href=\"#star-trek-deep-space-nine\"><i class=\"fas fa-link\"></i></a></h2> <p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2016/Federation_fleet_prepares_to_engage_Dominion_fleet.jpg\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"694\" height=\"530\" /> </p> <p>The second spin-off series which ran at the same time as TNG was set on a space station so instead of exploring adventures arrived via a stable wormhole. This series aired between 1993 and 1999 for 176 episodes.</p> <ol> <li>Emissary</li> <li>Duet</li> <li>The Way of the Warrior</li> <li>The Visitor</li> <li>Sacrifice of Angels</li> <li>Waltz</li> <li>Trials and Tribble-ations</li> <li>In the Pale Moonlight</li> <li>Far Beyond the Stars</li> <li>Siege of AR 558</li> </ol> <h2 id=\"star-trek-voyager\">Star Trek: Voyager<a class=\"anchor ms-1\" href=\"#star-trek-voyager\"><i class=\"fas fa-link\"></i></a></h2> <p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2016/Voyager_away_team.jpg\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"609\" height=\"499\" /> </p> <p>The third spin-off series ran after TNG and featured a female captain and a starship stranded in a remote part of the galaxy journeying home. This series aired between 1995 and 2001 for 172 episodes.</p> <ol> <li>Scorpions</li> <li>Year of Hell</li> <li>Caretaker</li> <li>Message in a Bottle</li> <li>Eye of the Needle</li> <li>Heroes and Demons</li> <li>Jetrel</li> <li>Timeless</li> <li>Pathfinder</li> <li>Riddles</li> </ol> <h2 id=\"star-trek-enterprise\">Star Trek: Enterprise<a class=\"anchor ms-1\" href=\"#star-trek-enterprise\"><i class=\"fas fa-link\"></i></a></h2> <p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2016/Andorians_pjem.jpg\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"669\" height=\"461\" /> </p> <p>The most recent spin-off ran after Voyager and was set 100 years before Kirk. This series aired between 2001 and 2005 for 98 episodes.</p> <ol> <li>Broken Bow</li> <li>The Andorian Incident</li> <li>Shuttlepod One</li> <li>In a Mirror Darkly</li> <li>Twilight</li> <li>Damage</li> <li>Azati Prime</li> <li>Regeneration</li> <li>Impulse</li> <li>Zero Hour</li> </ol> <p>I am not going to review each episode here, I will save that for future blogs. With 50 episodes that is one a week to get them all reviewed during Star Trek‚Äôs birthday year. We will see if I manage to keep to that schedule.</p>"
              - generic [ref=e7058]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e7060]: </item>

          - generic [ref=e7064]: <item>
          - generic [ref=e7065]:
            - generic [ref=e7066]:
              - generic [ref=e7067]: <title>
              - text: A look back at 2015
              - generic [ref=e7068]: </title>
            - generic [ref=e7069]:
              - generic [ref=e7070]: <link>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/look-back-2015/
              - generic [ref=e7071]: </link>
            - generic [ref=e7072]:
              - generic [ref=e7073]: <author>
              - text: funkysi1701
              - generic [ref=e7074]: </author>
            - generic [ref=e7075]:
              - generic [ref=e7076]: <pubDate>
              - text: Thu, 31 Dec 2015 20:00:45 +0000
              - generic [ref=e7077]: </pubDate>
            - generic [ref=e7078]:
              - generic [ref=e7079]: <guid>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/look-back-2015/
              - generic [ref=e7080]: </guid>
            - generic [ref=e7081]:
              - generic [ref=e7082]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7083]: term="Blogging"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Blogging
              - generic [ref=e7084]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7085]:
              - generic [ref=e7086]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7087]: term="James"
                - text: ">"
              - text: James
              - generic [ref=e7088]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7089]:
              - generic [ref=e7090]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7091]: term="Goals"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Goals
              - generic [ref=e7092]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7093]:
              - generic [ref=e7094]: <description>
              - text: <p>Wow! What an amazing year 2015 has been and with 2015 about to end I thought it would be good to look back at what happened in this amazing year.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="2015 Year in Review" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/151218181153-2015-year-in-review-biggest-stories-wrap-up-orig-00025316-large-169.jpg" loading="lazy" width="460" height="259" /> </p> <p><strong>January</strong></p> <p>I started the year with a declaration that 2015 would be my year of code. Well I have had a few breaks from programming but I have learnt loads this year. I have flitted a bit concentrating on different areas of programming but I think that has broadened my knowledge. I consider myself to be a <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/06/03/im-a-developer-now/">programmer now</a> , which I didn‚Äôt at the start of 2015.</p> <p><strong>February</strong></p> <p>A first for 2015 was appearing on a <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/01/27/podcasts/">podcast</a> . The Trekmate podcast <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/02/13/ten-forward-episode-135-anti-firbob-is-back-or-simons-desert-island-trek/">Ten Forward</a> were the lucky ones that got to experience my first attempt at talking to the world. This continued throughout the year with appearances on <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/07/30/upper-pylon-2-1-x-09-the-passenger/">Upper Pylon 2</a> , <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/10/08/the-hunted-tng-s3-e11-the-battle-bridge/">The Battle Bridge</a> and even the <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/11/12/star-trek-is-back-in-2017/">Sci-Fi Waffle</a> podcast.</p> <p>It was a sad time for Trekkies at the end of February when <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/02/28/hes-really-not-dead-as-long-as-we-remember-him/">Leonard Nimoy</a> passed away.</p> <p><strong>March</strong></p> <p>In March I talked about my recent efforts with <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/03/12/azure-traffic-manager/">Azure Traffic Manager</a> to help prevent downtime. I also spent a lot of time improving <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/03/05/database-deployment/">databases</a> which led me to consider ways to deploy it better.</p> <p>Also in March I attended an IT networking event called <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/03/22/networking-event/">ITBoss</a> . Free food and drinks and a discussion with fellow IT Managers.</p> <p><strong>April</strong></p> <p>April was a bit of a mixed bag. I celebrated my second wedding anniversary but I also said goodbye to my car due to financial reasons.</p> <p>I played about with a <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/04/11/the-raspberry-pi-adventure-starts/">Raspberry Pi</a> , mostly with the <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/04/15/security-camera-with-raspberry-pi-camera/">camera</a> . I really must make some time to play with it more.</p> <p><strong>May</strong></p> <p>In May I went to a C# User Group called Leeds Sharp, was great fun and I really need to make more time and go back in 2016. It did result in one of my <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/05/30/user-groups-and-f/">most popular blog posts</a> .</p> <p>Usually developers don‚Äôt enjoy finding bugs in their software but I had great fun when I realised I had a <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/05/22/overflow/">Stack Overflow</a> in one of my databases, it was easy to fix once I worked out what was going on.</p> <p>In May the UK went to the polls as we had another General Election.</p> <p><strong>June</strong></p> <p>In June I celebrated my <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/06/17/50th-blog-post/">50th Blog Post</a> . Amazing to think I had already written 50 Blog posts, even more now!</p> <p>Leeds Sharp had a coding challenge, to solve <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/06/26/sudoku-challenge/">Sodoku</a> puzzle programatically. Didn‚Äôt get it finished but made a good stab at it.</p> <p><strong>July</strong></p> <p>In July it was SysAdmin Day and I celebrated with my staff the amazing work we do keeping everything working.</p> <p>Microsoft launched <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/07/11/how-to-upgrade-to-windows-10/">Windows 10</a> in July, the latest operating system is being offered for free for a year.</p> <p><strong>August</strong></p> <p>In August everything changed as my son <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/09/03/baby-magic-and-becoming-a-father/">James</a> was born. I took time out from blogging and work during this time to spend with James.</p> <p>Before James was born I stepped down from my involvement with the <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/08/03/volunteering-for-a-technical-team/">technical team</a> at St Michael le Belfrey.</p> <p><strong>September</strong></p> <p>In september it was back to work, where I started planning how to add <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/09/24/adding-internet-connection-resiliency/">internet connections</a> to reduce the chance of outages.</p> <p><strong>October</strong></p> <p>In October I took James to a <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/10/22/james-goes-on-an-adventure-with-daddy/">dads group</a> . This was the first time Dad spent time with James without Mummy and it was awesome.</p> <p>I also celebrated my first birthday after becoming a father, was great to have a card from James. James also got the chance to spend time with my family in Nottingham.</p> <p><strong>November</strong></p> <p>In November the countdown to Christmas began with James appearing in his first Nativity as Jesus and dressed up as an Elf at a Christingle service.</p> <p>Exciting Star Trek news was announced this month, a new <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/11/12/star-trek-is-back-in-2017/">TV series</a> is to be aired in January 2017. No other details yet but very exciting.</p> <p><strong>December</strong></p> <p>December is all about <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/12/24/christmas-2015-fosters/">Christmas</a> and we had a great Christmas time as a family.</p> <p>Sadly York was hit by Floods just after Christmas, luckily my family was not affected but many others have been. Hopefully by the time you read this the cleanup will be well underway.</p> <p>Before Christmas I spent my time counting down the days with the <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/12/17/christmas-count-code/">Advent of Code</a> </p> <p><strong>What will 2016 bring?</strong></p> <p>I don‚Äôt know. There will be lots more time with James as he continues to learn and develop. I will continue to learn and develop my coding skills. Watch this space as I keep blogging about it.</p>
              - generic [ref=e7095]: </description>

              - generic [ref=e7114]: </pubDate>
            - generic [ref=e7115]:
              - generic [ref=e7116]: <guid>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/christmas-2015-fosters/
              - generic [ref=e7117]: </guid>
            - generic [ref=e7118]:
              - generic [ref=e7119]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7120]: term="James"
                - text: ">"
              - text: James
              - generic [ref=e7121]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7122]:
              - generic [ref=e7123]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7124]: term="Elf"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Elf
              - generic [ref=e7125]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7126]:
              - generic [ref=e7127]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7128]: term="Christmas"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Christmas
              - generic [ref=e7129]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7130]:
              - generic [ref=e7131]: <description>
              - text: <p>Four months ago James David Martin Foster was born. And he is even more awesome now than when he was born.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="James in a Christmas outfit" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/20151206_105450.jpg" loading="lazy" width="747" height="1328" /> </p> <p>As I write this James only has a few sleeps (as James sleeps multiple times in a day I can‚Äôt put an exact number) until his first Christmas. James is pretty much unaware of what is going on as he is still too young but that doesn‚Äôt stop his parents enjoying the season.</p> <p>He has lots of Christmas themed clothes which we have been enjoying taking pictures of him wearing. He makes a great looking elf I think.</p> <p>We took James to his first Christingle service at <a href="http://belfrey.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">St Michael le Belfrey</a> at the start of December. A Christingle service is where you stick a candle and cocktail sticks into an orange. James loved it, he already loves looking at lights so loved looking into the light from the candle.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="James at Christingle service" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/12333053_10153912153609155_79017677_o.jpg" loading="lazy" width="1144" height="2048" /> </p> <p>Another Christmas activity we did this year as a family was to appear in a nativity. St Michael le Belfrey every Christmas hold a cafe to tell people the good news about Christmas and they have a nativity outside which includes donkeys. Don‚Äôt we make a great holy family. (Excuse the coffee cups but it was cold.)</p> <p>Me and James‚Äôs mummy have gone a bit crazy with buying him presents, we have both got him lots of things to open on Christmas morning (or more likely mummy/daddy will do the opening)</p> <p>James also has three Christmas days to look forward to, with different sides of the family each no doubt with him as the centre of attention.</p> <p>Exciting times. Happy Christmas everyone, make yours as special as ours.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="Family in nativity scene" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/12309579_10153809916077792_2703731936729335666_o.jpg" loading="lazy" width="810" height="1080" /> </p>
              - generic [ref=e7132]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e7134]: </item>
        - generic [ref=e7135]:
          - generic [ref=e7138]: <item>
          - generic [ref=e7139]:
            - generic [ref=e7140]:
              - generic [ref=e7141]: <title>
              - text: The Christmas count down with code
              - generic [ref=e7142]: </title>
            - generic [ref=e7143]:
              - generic [ref=e7144]: <link>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/christmas-count-code/
              - generic [ref=e7145]: </link>
            - generic [ref=e7146]:
              - generic [ref=e7147]: <author>
              - text: funkysi1701
              - generic [ref=e7148]: </author>
            - generic [ref=e7149]:
              - generic [ref=e7150]: <pubDate>
              - text: Thu, 17 Dec 2015 20:00:45 +0000
              - generic [ref=e7151]: </pubDate>
            - generic [ref=e7152]:
              - generic [ref=e7153]: <guid>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/christmas-count-code/
              - generic [ref=e7154]: </guid>
            - generic [ref=e7155]:
              - generic [ref=e7156]:
                - text: <category

                - text: ">"
              - text: Code
              - generic [ref=e7158]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7159]:
              - generic [ref=e7160]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7161]: term="Challenge"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Challenge
              - generic [ref=e7162]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7163]:
              - generic [ref=e7164]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7165]: term="Santa"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Santa
              - generic [ref=e7166]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7167]:
              - generic [ref=e7168]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7169]: term="HappyChristmas"
                - text: ">"
              - text: HappyChristmas
              - generic [ref=e7170]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7171]:
              - generic [ref=e7172]: <description>
              - text: <p>In December we count down the days to Christmas. People often have advent calendars filled with chocolates or even Lego.</p> <p>But what about if you are a programmer, how can you count down the days till Christmas? What about if you had a daily Christmas themed coding challenge? Well <a href="https://www.adventofcode.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">www.adventofcode.com</a> is the answer. <img class="img-fluid" alt="" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/adventofcode.jpg" loading="lazy" width="691" height="767" /> </p> <p>Each day a new challenge is available. So far the challenges are related to Christmas and Santa delivering his presents. The challenge is split into two closely linked parts. You are given a randomly generated input and your need to give an answer using a short string or number.</p> <p>The challenges are getting harder, with some completely defeating me, (not surprising with my limited programming knowledge). The challenges are language independent so you could try them in javascript or c#. I have been using Visual Studio and C# and my code is viewable on <a href="https://github.com/funkysi/AdventSolution" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">github</a> .</p> <p>So far I have completed Challenges 1 to 6 and also 10. Partly because I found challenge 7 very difficult but I am hoping to have another go at it.</p> <p>While coding through these challenges I have done a fair amount of refactoring. I started off with a simple console app with most of my code in one method. As the number of challenges increased I started moving the code for each challenge into its own class, with methods and properties that were unique to the challenge. I also added a main menu so you can choose which challenge to run. Some of my code to answer the challenges takes some time to run so this was quite a time saver over running each challenge in order.</p> <p>These challenges are very good at teaching me things about coding. I have got to think about data structures, what is the best way to store this information, classes and methods and return types, how to output data to the screen, how to input/import data.</p> <p>Before I try and work on the next challenge lets have a look at the first challenge:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>Santa is trying to deliver presents in a large apartment building, but he can‚Äôt find the right floor ‚Äì the directions he got are a little confusing. He starts on the ground floor (floor 0) and then follows the instructions one character at a time. An opening parenthesis, (, means he should go up one floor, and a closing parenthesis, ), means he should go down one floor. </code></pre><p>This is a simple loop through a long string of ( and ) and keep track of the floor number you are on to calculate what floor Santa finishes on. The second part of the challenge asks at what point in your input string does santa reach the basement (floor -1)</p>
              - generic [ref=e7173]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e7175]: </item>

            - generic [ref=e7212]:
              - generic [ref=e7213]: <description>
              - text: <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/1-523x400.webp" loading="lazy" width="523" height="400" /> </p> <p>The Oatmeal created a comic which you really should check out. It can be found <a href="http://theoatmeal.com/comics/plane" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">here</a> .</p> <p>The comic tells the story of a plane crash, in which the 25 year old co-pilot goes back into the burning plane to rescue passengers and lead a group of survivors through the desert to find help.</p> <p>The co-pilot was named Gene Roddenberry, and after these events he stopped being a pilot and became a writer and eventually created Star Trek.</p> <p>In these uncertain times when you are stranded in the desert, get out and help someone, it may change the world.</p>

          - generic [ref=e7220]: <item>
          - generic [ref=e7221]:
            - generic [ref=e7222]:
              - generic [ref=e7223]: <title>
              - text: SQL Server Management Studio
              - generic [ref=e7224]: </title>
            - generic [ref=e7225]:
              - generic [ref=e7226]: <link>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/sql-server-management-studio/
              - generic [ref=e7227]: </link>
            - generic [ref=e7228]:
              - generic [ref=e7229]: <author>
              - text: funkysi1701
              - generic [ref=e7230]: </author>
            - generic [ref=e7231]:
              - generic [ref=e7232]: <pubDate>
              - text: Thu, 03 Dec 2015 00:00:00 +0000
              - generic [ref=e7233]: </pubDate>
            - generic [ref=e7234]:
              - generic [ref=e7235]: <guid>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/sql-server-management-studio/
              - generic [ref=e7236]: </guid>
            - generic [ref=e7237]:
              - generic [ref=e7238]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7239]: term="Database"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Database
              - generic [ref=e7240]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7241]:
              - generic [ref=e7242]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7243]: term="SQL"
                - text: ">"
              - text: SQL
              - generic [ref=e7244]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7245]:
              - generic [ref=e7246]: <description>
              - text: <p>I use SQL Server Management Studio all the time for writing queries, getting data and general SQL development.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="SQL Server Management Studio" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/sql-server-2012-management-studio-splash-screen.png" loading="lazy" width="529" height="360" /> </p> <p>I have enjoyed seeing the improvements that each new version of SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) introduced. One great improvement was intellisense.</p> <p>This feature saves typing and reduces errors by automatically suggesting tables, column names or other database objects.</p> <p>A common query that I get asked to write is provide a spreadsheet that gives the information that satisfies certain criteria. This is easy to do in SSMS, you can write the query, click execute and the rows that satisfy the criteria are displayed. These rows can then be easily copy/pasted into Excel or other spreadsheets.</p> <p>A common data item that gets stored in databases is addresses and addresses often contain line breaks to make the data display better. In the earlier versions of SSMS, when you copied and pasted these line breaks were ignored and the data displayed the same in SSMS as it did in Excel. However in the more recent version, theses line breaks got copied across breaking your spreadsheet and making it hard to see what data corresponded with what.</p> <p>Now I don‚Äôt know if this should be described as introducing a bug or fixing one. I can easily argue both sides. If your data contains a line break and you copy this data it should include the line break in the destination, but if it does that it displays badly in Excel.</p> <p>The fix I have been using until recently is to use the following TSQL command in my queries.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" style="color:#f8f8f2;background-color:#272822;-moz-tab-size:4;-o-tab-size:4;tab-size:4;"><code class="language-sql" data-lang="sql"><span style="display:flex;"><span><span style="color:#66d9ef">SELECT</span> <span style="color:#66d9ef">REPLACE</span>(<span style="color:#66d9ef">REPLACE</span>(<span style="color:#f92672">@</span>str, CHAR(<span style="color:#ae81ff">13</span>), <span style="color:#e6db74">&#34;), CHAR(10), &#34;</span>) </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This command replaces any line breaks with an empty string. Both Char(10) and Char(13) are needed because you can have different types of line breaks. This is great if you are writing the script from scratch but isn‚Äôt great if your are running a stored procedure or your query has a lot of columns.</p> <p>The answer to this is to use Visual Studio to run your SQL query. In Visual Studio you can write and run queries via Server Explorer and the results produced don‚Äôt contain line breaks. I have only just discovered this solution, but so far it has worked and is very easy to do, plus as I do most of my development in Visual Studio anyway it saves me having to open SSMS to test my queries.</p>
              - generic [ref=e7247]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e7249]: </item>

              - generic [ref=e7283]: <description>
              - text: <h2 id="over-50-off-this-black-friday">Over 50% Off this Black Friday!<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#over-50-off-this-black-friday"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h2> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="Black Friday Deals" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/86910937_t053ll31.jpg" loading="lazy" width="660" height="371" /> </p> <p>Yes your heard it correctly even <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com">www.funkysi1701.com</a> has amazing offers.</p> <p>It is like the whole world has gone ‚ÄúBlack Friday‚Äù mad, with every company in the world offering amazing and unmissable deals.</p> <p>So in an attempt to cash in on all the Black Friday fuss I will write a quick blog post about it.</p> <p>I mentioned 50% off well this month I have blogged 50% less than usual. There is one main reason for this, my new born son James is taking a lot of my time and energy and I think it will take a few months of sporadic blog posts before I get the balance right.</p> <p>I am not a big fan of spending just for the sake of it. Encouraging people to spend money they don‚Äôt have, on things they don‚Äôt need shouldn‚Äôt be encouraged. However times are hard so companies need to do what they need to, to try and make money.</p>

              - generic [ref=e7316]: <description>
              - text: "<p><img class=\"img-fluid\" alt=\"3f448330857e4ca7ba40ab5465a3c2cb62cdb98c\" src=\"https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/11/3f448330857e4ca7ba40ab5465a3c2cb62cdb98c.png\" loading=\"lazy\" width=\"620\" height=\"260\" /> </p> <p>As you have probably heard Star Trek is coming back to TV. I recently joined with the Sci Fi Waffle podcast to discuss.</p> <p>Sci Fi Waffle: Episode 12 ‚Äì STAR TREK IS BACK!!</p> <p>In this episode we discuss the great news that Star Trek IS BACK!!.</p> <p>Shawn and I are joined again by James Roberts and TrekMates News feed Editor Simon Foster to speculate about the announcement of a new Star Trek TV series due to debut in January 2017.</p> <p>James can be found on our sister podcast <a href=\"http://www.trekmate.org.uk/category/the-battle-bridge/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Battle Bridge</a> and Simon can be found on Twitter <a href=\"https://twitter.com/funkysi1701\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">@funkysi1701</a> </p> <p>To listen go <a href=\"http://www.trekmate.org.uk/sci-fi-waffle-episode-11-star-trek-is-back/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">http://www.trekmate.org.uk/sci-fi-waffle-episode-11-star-trek-is-back/</a> , to leave feedback go <a href=\"http://forum.trekmatefamily.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">http://forum.trekmatefamily.com/</a> </p>"

            - generic [ref=e7352]:
              - generic [ref=e7353]: <description>
              - text: <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/10/world.png" loading="lazy" width="648" height="423" /> </p> <p>Having a website is an easy way to reach people across the globe. This website has reached people in almost every continent.</p> <p>I have had visitors in each of the following countries.</p> <ul> <li>United States</li> <li>United Kingdom</li> <li>Canada</li> <li>Germany</li> <li>Australia</li> <li>India</li> <li>France</li> <li>Vietnam</li> <li>Netherlands</li> <li>Poland</li> <li>China</li> <li>Russia</li> <li>Sweden</li> <li>European Union</li> <li>New Zealand</li> <li>Hungary</li> <li>Norway</li> <li>Spain</li> <li>Brazil</li> <li>Hong Kong SAR China</li> <li>Belgium</li> <li>Denmark</li> <li>Italy</li> <li>Switzerland</li> <li>Finland</li> <li>Turkey</li> <li>Romania</li> <li>Singapore</li> <li>Israel</li> <li>Indonesia</li> <li>Serbia</li> <li>South Africa</li> <li>Lithuania</li> <li>Mexico</li> <li>Ireland</li> <li>South Korea</li> <li>Taiwan</li> <li>Greece</li> <li>Bulgaria</li> <li>Ukraine</li> <li>Japan</li> <li>Austria</li> <li>Kenya</li> <li>Portugal</li> <li>Czech Republic</li> <li>Colombia</li> <li>Philippines</li> <li>United Arab Emirates</li> <li>Moldova</li> <li>Slovenia</li> <li>Malaysia</li> <li>Ghana</li> <li>Argentina</li> <li>Venezuela</li> <li>Bangladesh</li> <li>Iceland</li> <li>Croatia</li> <li>Panama</li> <li>Belarus</li> <li>Slovakia</li> <li>Albania</li> <li>Kazakhstan</li> <li>Algeria</li> <li>Puerto Rico</li> <li>Thailand</li> <li>Estonia</li> <li>U.S. Virgin Islands</li> <li>Pakistan</li> <li>Latvia</li> <li>Chile</li> <li>Sri Lanka</li> <li>Malta</li> <li>Costa Rica</li> <li>Morocco</li> <li>Ethiopia</li> <li>R√©union</li> <li>Uruguay</li> <li>Honduras</li> <li>Cyprus</li> <li>Tunisia</li> <li>Nepal</li> <li>Cameroon</li> <li>Paraguay</li> <li>Gambia</li> <li>Peru</li> <li>Mauritius</li> <li>Bermuda</li> <li>Cambodia</li> <li>Jersey</li> <li>Egypt</li> <li>Macedonia</li> </ul> <p>How cool is that! If you know anyone from any country not mentioned above, send them a link to this page and lets see if we can get this blog seen in even more countries.</p> <p>Only a few years ago it would have been incredibly difficult to communicate your ideas to the whole world, now it is available to everyone at a touch of a button.</p> <p>The internet has a lot to answer for. On the one hand it is blamed for a decrease of communication between people as they stare at their devices all the time, but on the other hand it has greatly improved communication over larger distances like the use of Skype or the ability to broadcast your ideas on websites and social media.</p>

              - text: <h2 id="i-dont-want-to-go-to-work-just-want-to-hang-with-captain-kirk">I don‚Äôt want to go to work Just want to hang with Captain Kirk<a class="anchor ms-1" href="#i-dont-want-to-go-to-work-just-want-to-hang-with-captain-kirk"><i class="fas fa-link"></i></a></h2> <p>I am a big Warp 11 fan. Warp 11 are a Star Trek rock band from Sacramento, California. Their songs often feature bad language, sex and drinking but always feature references to Star Trek characters and episodes and a good dose of humour.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/10/redAlertCover_02.jpg" loading="lazy" width="250" height="250" /> </p> <p>I first listened to Warp 11 in about 2004 and have listened to every album they have released since. The second album Red Alert is probably my favourite but all their albums have a few tracks which I love. They have just released their seventh album and to celebrate this I will list my favourite tracks.</p> <p>All lyrics are by Warp 11 and no infringement is intended, if you like what you see go to their website (<a href="https://www.warp11.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">www.warp11.com</a> ), or buy their music. Also Warp 11 if you are reading this, come to the UK, I would love to hear you perform live.</p> <ol start="10"> <li><strong>It‚Äôs Dead Jim</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the fourth album <strong>It‚Äôs Dead Jim</strong>. This song came out after Enterprise was cancelled and is all about the fact there was no more new trek being made. It was a bleak time to be a trekkie and I shared Warp 11‚Äôs sadness in this song.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>First they took my TOS Then they took my TNG Said ‚Äúbon voyage‚Äù to Voyager Now there‚Äôs nothing left for me Decommissioned DS9 Now there‚Äôs no more Enterprise Erased the animated show Yeah, she met a quick demise The final frontier has been finalized There ain‚Äôt no coming back It‚Äôs getting no reprise It boldly came and went Got no Trek to represent I never thought the day Would come that I had to say It‚Äôs dead Jim Space is cold and so am I Just like Kirk my show has died Everything has gone awry I guess it‚Äôs time to say goodbye ‚ÄòCause Scotty‚Äôs gone and so is Bones They took their final voyage home And I guess I‚Äôve always known That some day I‚Äôd be alone Tore down the sets today Gave the plastic ears away Sold the props on eBay Left my life in disarray It‚Äôs dead Jim Until they bring it back again </code></pre><ol start="9"> <li><strong>7 of Mine</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the second album <strong>Red Alert</strong>. 7 of 9 is one sexy character so it is no surprise that Warp 11 chose to sing about that in a few songs and I think this is probably the best example.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>Flesh and bone and silicone You‚Äôre all by yourself, but you‚Äôre never alone You‚Äôre pretty smooth, for a chick full of wires So cold to the touch But you set me on fire Assimilate me Dominate me Short circuit my mind Energize me Your thighs always rise me Let‚Äôs go out and make your gears grind Seven of mine One minute you‚Äôre cruel And then you‚Äôre kind You gave me a virus, but baby I don‚Äôt mind ‚ÄòCause I self destruct when I see your behind I‚Äôll show you the difference between seven and nine Chorus Well, life and love are so absurd And assimilation is the final word Resistance is futile can‚Äôt you see So, come on now baby and assimilate me I‚Äôll give you an identity Locutus ain‚Äôt got nothing on me, oh yeah Let‚Äôs grab a shuttle and go to your cube You bring the oil and honey I‚Äôll bring the lube It‚Äôs not monogamy ‚ÄòCause in the end When I‚Äôm f****** you, I‚Äôm f****** all of your friends Chorus </code></pre><ol start="8"> <li><strong>Old Country Dr.(The Ballad Of Bones)</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the second album <strong>Red Alert</strong>. A song dedicated to Bones so of course it is great. The use of harmonica makes you think of the country doctor which is a nice touch. This song gets a sequel as well on one of the later albums.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>Well, they call me Bones and I‚Äôm third in command Second in line is a man I just can‚Äôt stand He‚Äôs a green blooded, pointy-eared, seven year itch And when he pon farrs He‚Äôll try to make me his bitch Well, I may or may not have divorced my wife But I damn sure pulled the plug on my daddy‚Äôs life And two months later, well, they found a cure I‚Äôm just an old country doctor on a damned five year tour The damned teleporter Yeah, it gives me the creeps The first time I used it I couldn‚Äôt get it up for weeks Now my tricorder‚Äôs busted And sick bay just stinks I guess I‚Äôll just go replicate me a drink Chorus Well, Jim is the captain of this here ship We call her the Enterprise, and the crew‚Äôs pretty hip Yeah, the girls all wear go-go boots and miniskirts And I spend my days patching all the red shirts Well, I have been asked to do many a thing Outside the area of my expertise Damn it Jim, I know I‚Äôve told you before Damn it Jim, I know I‚Äôve told you before Damn it Jim, damn it Jim, I told you before I‚Äôm just an old country doctor on a damned five year tour Just an old country doctor on a damned five year tour </code></pre><ol start="7"> <li><strong>Space Happy</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the second album <strong>Red Alert</strong>. This song is just solid good fun, with a catchy chorus that I can‚Äôt help singing along to.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>Gonna take a five year tour Boldly go where no man‚Äôs gone before Gonna travel to the end And make new friends Move ahead warp factor ten Put a miniskirt on my yeoman Represent the human race And we‚Äôll make space A happy place To boldly go where no man‚Äôs gone before I think I sang that line once before (But I‚Äôm not too sure) We‚Äôll be so happy ‚Äì can‚Äôt you see? A zero-g community Gonna travel to new worlds Beam on down and meet some green girls Gonna see what we can see A fancy-free galaxy Chorus Come and take a tour with me They‚Äôll be no Kahns or Kobiashi Gonna travel to the end And make new friends With aliens Chorus </code></pre><ol start="6"> <li><strong>And Thats Why I‚Äôm In A Star Trek Band</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the second album <strong>Red Alert</strong>. Not only does the start of this song make me think of the postman pat theme but it is good fun.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>I love gettin‚Äô hummers from chicks dressed as Klingons Bumpy heads bobbin‚Äô up and down Like their necks have a spring on And I know their teeth hurt But I still get my thing on And that‚Äôs why And that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm in a Star Trek band I wanna tag team a stripper with Mr. William Shatner He‚Äôll take the front and hell, I‚Äôll take the back-ner And when we blow We‚Äôre gonna reach warp factor And that‚Äôs why And that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm in a Star Trek band Well, people ask me Where do I find my joy? Do I like hot girls, green aliens or young boys? Well, I got two words for you my friend ‚Äì Leonard Nimoy And that‚Äôs why And that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm in a Star Trek band And that‚Äôs why And that‚Äôs why We‚Äôre in a Star Trek band </code></pre><ol start="5"> <li><strong>Everything I Do (I Do With William Shatner)</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the second album <strong>Red Alert</strong>. This was probably the first Warp 11 song I heard and it made me want to listen to the rest. Warp 11 don‚Äôt just mention trek, they are actual fans as you can tell from the references that litter their songs.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>Everything I do, I do with William Shatner Loosing all my hair while my belly‚Äôs growing fat-ner And when I drink too much He holds my hair in his hands And while I‚Äôm blowing chunks He treats me like the captain Oh, when we get together we boldly go Talk about our favorite episodes I don‚Äôt want to go to work Just want to hang with Captain Kirk And if I had my way I‚Äôd make it so Everything I do, I do with William Shatner We drink a couple of brews Go to the Laundromat-ner When our clothes are dry We fold them up together ‚ÄòCause everything I do, I do with William Shatner Chorus Hey, spend more time with him than George Takei Say full speed ahead and we‚Äôre on our way He is so mysterious His middle name‚Äôs Tiberius And he‚Äôll make me his cabin boy someday Hey Bill ‚Äì Let‚Äôs go get a tan Hey Bill ‚Äì And a green woman Hey Bill ‚Äì We‚Äôll kill some Romulans Hey Bill ‚Äì I‚Äôm your number one fan ‚ÄòCause everything I do, I do with William Shatner We go to the rodeo and put on our cowboy hat-ners When we paint the town We buy each other dinner We‚Äôre fully functional Just like Brent Spiner Everything I do, I do with William Shatner And don‚Äôt you wish that you could do it too </code></pre><ol start="4"> <li><strong>What would William Shatner do?</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the fifth album <strong>I Don‚Äôt Want to Go to Heaven as Long as They Have Vulcans in Hell</strong>. Everyone‚Äôs been in situations where they would like to keep there fandom a secret. And what would William Shatner do?</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>I‚Äôve got a girl, the coolest girl in the world But she ain‚Äôt fly for the guys in sci-fi And I‚Äôm a guy with a model Enterprise Imagine her surprise if she ever finds out I‚Äôve got a queen, but she only wears blue jeans And I am a guy in Kirk t-shirt Black boots and a red miniskirt I‚Äôll be in world of hurt if she ever finds out I‚Äôve got to think about it I‚Äôve got to work it through If she learns my dark secret What would William Shatner do? I‚Äôve got a chick, in bed a lunatic Won‚Äôt be my whore if she knows I love Star Wars And I know only one thing for sure I‚Äôll never score If she ever finds out I‚Äôve got to make a choice now Deceive her or tell her true I know Vulcans never lie but What would William Shatner do? I love War of the Worlds, got a b**** for green girls Alien nations, deep space stations I love flying saucers, say ‚Äúlive long and prosper‚Äù ‚ÄúMay the force be with you‚Äù, Mr. Sulu I want to be your man, ‚Äúby your command‚Äù Don‚Äôt want us to be undone, ‚Äúdanger Will Robinson!‚Äù And if I decree ‚Äúbeedee beedee bee‚Äù Does that mean we‚Äôll be through? What would William Shatner do? </code></pre><ol start="3"> <li><strong>Trekie Girl</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the second album <strong>Red Alert</strong>. When I first listened to this song I was a single young man, so of course I dreamed about finding my own Trekie Girl. My wife now shares my love of Trek and looks extremely hot in a starfleet uniform.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>She knows every episode She wears the boots that go-go-go She‚Äôs got a red miniskirt She makes me play Captain Kirk Trekkie girl, Trekkie girl We go to conventions She gives me erections Girl ‚Äì my Trekkie girl She paints her skin green And it‚Äôs not Halloween She rocks my brave new world She always acts so logical She drives a Volvo Iike it‚Äôs our space shuttle (of love) She looks just like Britney Spears Just add a few pounds and some pointy ears Trekkie girl, Trekkie girl She loves outer space Has a black and white face Oh, girl ‚Äì my Trekkie girl I‚Äôm her Leonard Nimoy She‚Äôs the real McCoy She‚Äôs got a Spock haircut with curls And on some nights she tells me Put my symbiote inside her She separates my saucer Yeah, she knows just what to say And on nights when I loose power Well it doesn‚Äôt even phaser She grabs my captain‚Äôs log Torpedoes away She knows every episode She wears the boots that go-go-go She‚Äôs got a red miniskirt She makes me play Captain Kirk Trekkie girl, Trekkie girl We go to conventions She gives me erections Girl ‚Äì my Trekkie girl She paints her skin green And it‚Äôs not Halloween Oh, girl ‚Äì my Trekkie girl She loves outer space Has a black and white face Oh, girl ‚Äì my Trekkie girl I‚Äôm her Leonard Nimoy She‚Äôs the real McCoy My girl ‚Äì Trekkie girl </code></pre><ol start="2"> <li><strong>A Song for People Who Never Watch Star Trek</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the third album <strong>Boldly go down on me</strong>. This really tells you all you need to know about original series trek, plus I like singing the first line of this song to my son (also called James)</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>There was this guy His name was Jim You can call him Kirk Or the Captain He had a tan And lots of women Every episode He got to blow his l*** He worked with Spock He was a rock No emotion Nothing could rattle him His blood was green And Pon Farr could make him scream And lose control Though that‚Äôs illogical Each week they‚Äôd all warp through space Fight an alien race And the Vulcan would pinch a neck If you want to learn more Go to the video store Or just listen to this Song for people who never watch Star Trek Then there was Bones Dr. McCoy Worked with Nurse Chapel And removed the red shirt shrapnel Chased the miniskirts Screaming, ‚ÄúDammit, Kirk!‚Äù Wait that wasn‚Äôt him He was screaming, ‚ÄúDammit Jim!‚Äù Each week on the Enterprise All the red shirts would die But no one noticed or got upset And the next generation Will watch in syndication Or just listen to this Song for people who never watch Star Trek And for three seasons You know what they‚Äôd do They‚Äôd boldly go With the rest of their crew Like Scotty He was a Scot And Chekov He screamed a lot And Uhura And Sulu But let‚Äôs face it After Kirk, Spock and McCoy Who gives a f*** about the rest of the crew? </code></pre><ol> <li><strong>The Saddest Song Ever Written About Star Trek</strong></li> </ol> <p>From the fourth album <strong>It‚Äôs Dead Jim</strong>. This song really encapsulates the sadness of Star Trek‚Äôs cancellation and the passing away of some of Star Treks greats.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>It was a warm summer‚Äôs night when I sat down to write The prettiest song ever written about Star Trek The sky was clear Full of stars above I thought of Kirk and his crew And their mission of love And I sang the first verse Of the prettiest song ever written about Star Trek When the words came out Everything was wrong For those who‚Äôd boldly go Had already gone ‚ÄòCause the show was cancelled And the dream was dead And a red alert started wailing in my head And I realized I had written The saddest song ever written About Star Trek Now the sky was dark Devoid of love And Roddenberry‚Äôs ashes were floating up above Raining down on a man Singing the saddest song ever written about Star Trek And now Bones is nothing but bones He finally went and took his final voyage home And Scotty‚Äôs body just couldn‚Äôt take much more And I‚Äôm sure this is the saddest Song ever written about Star Trek I thought about space And the final frontier And I shed a tear as I finished The saddest song ever written about Star Trek </code></pre>
              - generic [ref=e7391]: </description>

              - text: James goes on an adventure with Daddy
              - generic [ref=e7401]: </title>
            - generic [ref=e7402]:
              - generic [ref=e7403]: <link>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/james-goes-on-an-adventure-with-daddy/
              - generic [ref=e7404]: </link>
            - generic [ref=e7405]:
              - generic [ref=e7406]: <author>
              - text: funkysi1701
              - generic [ref=e7407]: </author>
            - generic [ref=e7408]:
              - generic [ref=e7409]: <pubDate>
              - text: Thu, 22 Oct 2015 20:00:45 +0000
              - generic [ref=e7410]: </pubDate>
            - generic [ref=e7411]:
              - generic [ref=e7412]: <guid>
              - text: https://www.funkysi1701.com/posts/2015/james-goes-on-an-adventure-with-daddy/
              - generic [ref=e7413]: </guid>
            - generic [ref=e7414]:
              - generic [ref=e7415]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7416]: term="Baby"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Baby
              - generic [ref=e7417]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7418]:
              - generic [ref=e7419]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7420]: term="James"
                - text: ">"
              - text: James
              - generic [ref=e7421]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7422]:
              - generic [ref=e7423]:
                - text: <category
                - generic [ref=e7424]: term="Father"
                - text: ">"
              - text: Father
              - generic [ref=e7425]: </category>
            - generic [ref=e7426]:
              - generic [ref=e7427]: <description>
              - text: <p>This weekend I took James on an adventure. As he is only 8 weeks old it was a fairly low key adventure but hopefully he enjoyed himself.</p> <p>St Michael le Belfrey have been organizing an event for Dads once a month and this month I wanted to give it a go. I have been looking forward to going for a while.</p> <p><img class="img-fluid" alt="" src="https://www.funkysi1701.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=800,quality=75/images/2015/10/12074836_10153714959677792_5717618456858661253_n.jpg" loading="lazy" width="960" height="640" /> </p> <p>Looking after a baby is woman‚Äôs work. Now I am not being sexist but men are just not equipped. We can‚Äôt feed them, we don‚Äôt form the same emotional bonds and I suspect I am sleeping through the worst of his crying.</p> <p>That said I still want to help and be involved in looking after my son. But my natural inclination is to let mummy do most things and help where needed. Going to this dads event was my first chance to do things without mummy being around.</p> <p>So after James had his first feed and his bag had been filled with bottles of milk, nappies, change of clothes and all the other essential accessories for looking after a baby, I left the house with him strapped to my chest.</p> <p>The event was very low key. Once I got there I unloaded James from my chest and was left to spend time with him with the occasional chat from other dads, offers of coffee and sausage sandwiches from the organizers.</p> <p>James loves staring at the ceiling and the Storehouse had lots of bright lights for him to stare at. He also got to say hello to one of the other babies he has met before at church and the mums group my wife goes to. But it was not all smooth sailing, James didn‚Äôt like me sitting down, so I had to stand up holding him close to keep him calm. If I tried to sit down and offer him his bottle he would get grumpy.</p> <p>I think it is great that there are events like this for parents. A lot of events are targeted at mothers which is as it should be as they have the majority of work to do, but dads need the odd event to support them as well. Hopefully me and James will be back for more adventures like this.</p> <p>One of the things I am looking forward to as James gets older is taking him to places and spending time 1 to 1 with him like I did with my father. I don‚Äôt know what his interests will be but whatever it is I want to be there to encourage him.</p>
              - generic [ref=e7428]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e7430]: </item>

            - generic [ref=e7467]:
              - generic [ref=e7468]: <description>
              - text: <p>I recently read a blog post by <a href="http://blog.sqlauthority.com/2015/10/06/sql-server-steps-to-backup-to-windows-azure-storage/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Pinal Dave</a> about how you can backup straight to Azure Storage. The procedure he described is only available for SQL Server 2014 or later.</p> <p>I won‚Äôt go into detail of this method as Pinal describes it better than I can, but the basic of it requires setting up credentials and then running a backup command that includes the URL of the storage container on Azure.</p> <p>Unfortunately I am running SQL Server 2005 so this process will not work for me but it did start me thinking of what ways there might be for me to use.</p> <p>The next thing I tried was <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40740&amp;WT.mc_id=Blog_SQL_Announce_DI" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Microsoft SQL Server Backup to Microsoft Azure Tool</a> . Unfortunately I did not get this tool to work correctly on my setup. However it sounds like a flexible tool that allows compression and encryption of your backup files. This tool redirects your backup files to your Azure Storage so even if I had got it to work correctly it would not have been an ideal solution as I want local copies of my backup files as well.</p> <p>After this I started to look at powershell again. Following on from my recent success with <a href="https://www.funkysi1701.com/2015/10/01/copying-settings-to-an-azure-website/">powershell</a> I know how to connect to my Azure account so all I needed to script was copying a file from my server to Azure.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>Get-ChildItem *.bak -File -Recurse | Set-AzureStorageBlobContent -Container $DestContainer -Force </code></pre><p>This command gets all the backup files in a directory (the recurse switch looks in sub directories as well) and then pipes them to the Set-AzureStorageBlobContent command. This command uploads them to the storage container defined in $DestContainer. I have added the Force switch so that it will replace any files on Azure which have the same name.</p> <p>I have only been using this script for the last few days but so far it has been working well. Now if I completely loose all data from the office I can restore from any other location using the data saved on Azure. A great improvement to my disaster recovery policy.</p>
              - generic [ref=e7469]: </description>
          - generic [ref=e7471]: </item>

            - generic [ref=e7504]:
              - generic [ref=e7505]: <description>
              - text: "<p>My latest podcast can be found <a href=\"http://www.trekmate.org.uk/the-hunted-tng-s3-e11-the-battle-bridge/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">http://www.trekmate.org.uk/the-hunted-tng-s3-e11-the-battle-bridge/</a> and feedback can be left on the trekmate forums <a href=\"http://forum.trekmatefamily.com/2015/10/the-hunted-tng-s3-e11-review-the-battle-bridge/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">http://forum.trekmatefamily.com/2015/10/the-hunted-tng-s3-e11-review-the-battle-bridge/</a> </p> <p>While the Enterprise-D is reviewing a seemingly idyllic planet‚Äôs application for Federation membership, an escaped prisoner leads its crew to discover an ugly secret: the government‚Äôs shameful treatment of its war veterans.</p> <p>Today James and Lou discuss (The Hunted) and what we think of it and much more as well as listener feedback with tonight‚Äôs guest host Simon.</p> <p>Credit: Main Title Theme (TV Edit) was arranged by <a href=\"http://en.memory-alpha.org/wiki/Dennis_McCarthy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Dennis McCarthy</a> and composed by <a href=\"http://en.memory-alpha.org/wiki/Jerry_Goldsmith\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Jerry Goldsmith</a> and <a href=\"http://en.memory-alpha.org/wiki/Alexander_Courage/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Alexander Courage</a> </p> <p>You can download the MP3 version of this show by <a href=\"http://media.blubrry.com/trekmate/p/media.blubrry.com/previouslyalpha/p/media.blubrry.com/trekmatesupplemental/p/media.blubrry.com/loutrekshow/p/media.techpodcasts.com/loutrekshow/p/www.trekmate.org.uk/battlebridge/tbb-s3e11-the_hunted.mp3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">clicking here</a> .</p>"
